title: Don't hide the nav bar pre-KitKat.
message:
Don't hide the nav bar pre-KitKat.

Doing so puts us into the "break glass to continue" mode
used by video players starting with JELLY_BEAN, which is
seriously not what we want.

title: Don't use the SYSTEM_UI_FLAGs on pre-JB devices.
message: Don't use the SYSTEM_UI_FLAGs on pre-JB devices.

title: Explicitly adapt to system decor.
message:
Explicitly adapt to system decor.

android:fitsSystemWindows is a nice idea, but it totally
breaks when you have multiple views that each need to adapt
to the status and navigation bars (since the first View that
returns true for fitSystemWindows() aborts the traversal).

For many apps this isn't a problem because you can simply
contain all your views in a single layout that fits the
system windows, but since Markers has a Slate view that
extends underneath the decor we need to apply the fitting
somewhere else. The next logical approach would be to create
a single large layout to hold all the palettes and other UI,
but that introduces a lot of unnecessary overdraw.

Here, we nominate a single view (I chose LogoView) to catch
fitSystemWindows() and apply those insets to many views
onscreen that might need them. As it happens adding inset
padding to these views doesn't muck around with the overall
layout so this works pretty well in practice. (You might see
a similar technique going on in the AOSP sources for
Launcher3.)

While this fixes outstanding bugs with older versions of
Android, I think this technique (entering immersive mode
only when the palettes are gone) isn't all that useful in
practice. Rather, I think Markers just needs to run in
immersive mode all the time, or perhaps with a (gasp)
setting.

title: Fixing too-many-undo's in tiles.
message:
Fixing too-many-undo's in tiles.

Here's something astonishing: off-by-one-errors are such a
common programming error that occasionally you make so many
of them that they cancel one another out and the behavior is
essentially correct. Only when you go back to fix or add
something that depends on the intended behavior do you
notice the problem, and then it becomes something of a
pest-control problem to fix all the errors.

title: Fix NPEs drawing bitmaps.
message:
Fix NPEs drawing bitmaps.

Root cause: specifying a null src rect causes a crash on 3.x and 4.0.x when hw
acceleration is in use:

    java.lang.NullPointerException
    	at android.view.GLES20Canvas.drawBitmap(GLES20Canvas.java:611)
    	at android.view.GLES20RecordingCanvas.drawBitmap(GLES20RecordingCanvas.java:90)
    	at com.google.android.apps.markers.ToolButton$PenTypeButton.onDraw(ToolButton.java:189)
    	at android.view.View.draw(View.java:9279)
    	at android.view.View.getDisplayList(View.java:8742)
    	at android.view.ViewGroup.drawChild(ViewGroup.java:2554)
        [...]

Public bug: http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=21364

Fixed in JB.

title: Reduce double-drawing at each touch point along the stroke.
message: Reduce double-drawing at each touch point along the stroke.

title: Performance: stop using PathMeasure to draw strokes
message:
Performance: stop using PathMeasure to draw strokes

This was only useful when we had Bezier curves, but it's
much faster to just step along linearly now.

title: Separate smoothing parameters for position & size/pressure.
message: Separate smoothing parameters for position & size/pressure.

title: Assume stylus is calibrated.
message:
Assume stylus is calibrated.

This means removing it from the entire pressure calibration
system, not only not being influenced by current calibration
settings but not feeding input to the calibration either.
The PressureCooker is now purely a TOOL_TYPE_FINGER
calibration system.

Also fixed a bug where the tool type on PressureCooker
output was not being set correctly.

Thanks to my niece Isabel Makulski for requiring I fix this. :)

title: Precise stylus input.
message:
Precise stylus input.

If a stylus is detected, don't do any smoothing of the input.

message: Detect styli on ICS, plus a hack for the Flyer.

message: Further improvements to new color palette.

message: New color layout. Untested on phone.

message: probably should be in Buganizer but whatever

message:
Save temporary in onPause instead of onStop.

message:
Work on revised HUD layout.

message: Pull over new pressure debug code from partner branch.

title: Revised actionbar icons.
message:
Revised actionbar icons.

Now offer a "clear without save" as well as "clear with save" because sometimes you just want to crumple up your drawing and throw it away. (Consequently the icon is an angry scribble.)

title: WIP: new UI and quick-save workflow
message: WIP: new UI and quick-save workflow

title: Now use pressure + size.
message:
Now use pressure + size.

This gives us some stroke variation on devices that report
only size information (e.g., HTC Flyer). Will make results a
little strange on devices that report *both*.

Also: move xlarge UI to large (again, for 7" tablets like
Flyer).

title: forgot to re-enable the fat marker (v0.7.2.1)
message: forgot to re-enable the fat marker (v0.7.2.1)

title: Return to a simpler time.
message:
Return to a simpler time.

All the DrawStream stuff has been factored out to return
Markers to its raster-based roots. The 'erase' color
remains, however, and bugs related to resizing the bitmap on
rotation have been squashed.

Finally, the PressureCooker has been pulled out into its own
file to facilitate its removal (for sample code).

title: Some early scaling work.
message:
Some early scaling work.

Invalidations are getting screwed up, as is rescaling after
translating. Strokes are not being unscaled appropriately so
it's tough to do detail work.

But it's a start.

The right solution is to replace all the
viewportScale/viewportTranslate variables with a prev and
current matrix. This will help when transforming the spots
and the invalidations.

title: Fixed loading bitmaps.
message:
Fixed loading bitmaps.

Also reduced the amount of invalidation required on undo.

title: Major progress toward panning.
message:
Major progress toward panning.

You can now pan around an infinite canvas and draw where you
like. When you save, only the current viewport is currently
captured. Likewise: loading is way broken (the bitmap isn't
even inserted in the draw stack, let alone load/save DrawOps
which is what really needs to be done anyway).

But it is a start.

title: Erase support.
message:
Erase support.

The stroke bitmap is now the 'current' bitmap. The drawing bitmap
is now the 'previous' (undo) bitmap.

title: Disable tool quasimodes if split touch is not available.
message: Disable tool quasimodes if split touch is not available.

title: New main layout.
message:
New main layout.

Everything on the left for xlarge; tools at left and colors at bottom for phones.

message:
Checkpoint ephemeral tool support.

(Maybe disable the pressed state pre-Honeycomb?)

title: Split touch events support.
message:
Split touch events support.

The target SDK is now Honeycomb, allowing the colors and
canvas to receive touch events simultaneously.

Reimplemented the color selector so it can be scrubbed (drag
your finger along, switching colors as it goes). Combine
this with split touch events to create OMG RAINBOW PONIES.

Version: 0.4
